page.title: 07EVENTS.
page.content: {ANNUAL FESTIVITIES IN OWSTON { ___________________________ Owston Harvest Festival is a big party for the villagers who, together with friends and relations from outside, all sit down together for Harvest Supper after the special church serice. Cold meat,salad and apple pie are prepared and served by the ladies and, following the meal, all the produce from the church is auctioned for funds. On the 5th November, Owston holds a Guy Fawkes party with a large bonfire outside the Village Hall. Fireworks are lit, refreshments contributed by everyone and mulled wine handed round. After the carol service at Christmas the congregation has a party with mulled wine and mince pies. Three gardens open under the National Gardens Scheme in summer.
